desc: The WHSC1L1 gene encodes the NSD3 histone lysine methyltransferase. WHSC1L1 methylates both the H3K4 residue, which constitutes an epigenetic mark for transcriptional activation, and the H3K27 residue, which acts as a repressive mark (PMID: 16682010). Thus, it is controversial whether this gene acts as an oncogene or a tumor suppressor (PMID: 20599755). WHSC1L1 is altered by amplification in a subset of various cancers, including breast and lung tumors (PMID: 20940404, 25942451; cBioPortal, MSKCC, Dec. 2016).

articles.title: The NSD3L histone methyltransferase regulates cell cycle and cell invasion in breast cancer cells.
articles.reference: Zhou Z et al. Biochemical and biophysical research communications. 2010 Jul 30;398(3)565-70.

articles.title: Characterization of a novel WHSC1-associated SET domain protein with H3K4 and H3K27 methyltransferase activity.

articles.title: Transforming properties of 8p11-12 amplified genes in human breast cancer.

articles.title: The NSD family of protein methyltransferases in human cancer.
articles.reference: Vougiouklakis T et al. Epigenomics. 2015 Aug;7(5)863-74.

desc: WHSC1L1, a histone methyltransferase, is altered by amplification in various cancers.
